page.title: 20NETHERTON VALLEY - UPTON
page.content: The{Netherton Valley }is reached by an unclassified road to the north of{ {Hurstbourne Tarrant.}It's wide grass verges are favourite picnicing places.There were two entrances to Doiley Manor from this road, but one,a stone arch, now forms the entrance to Prosperous Farm. The iron gate in this arch came from Newgate Prison. A local ghost story happens in this area. A dancing light is seen to cross the A343 on the hill to the north of Prosperous Farm. It travels into the fields before disappearing.A local sheepdog refused to walk past the place, and had to be taken home another way. The bridge in the field on the right of the valley, carries the Manor drive across an old cattle droving route. There is a teasel bed still growing in{Upton}a remnant from the days when the wool trade thrived.
